query.query: When was the most recent super bowl?
query.result: The most recent Super Bowl was Super Bowl LVII, which took place on February 12, 2023. The game was played at the State Farm Stadium in Glendale, Arizona, and featured the Kansas City Chiefs against the Philadelphia Eagles. According to Sports Business Journal, the game had an audience of 113.1 million viewers, which is the third-best Super Bowl audience in history.

query.q: When was the most recent super bowl?
query.a: The most recent Super Bowl was Super Bowl LIV, which was played on February 2, 2020. The Kansas City Chiefs defeated the San Francisco 49ers by a score of 31-20 to win their first Super Bowl championship in 50 years.

query.q: What was the most recent super bowl called?
query.a: The most recent Super Bowl is Super Bowl LVII, which was played on February 7, 2023. The Kansas City Chiefs defeated the Philadelphia Eagles with a score of 38-35.

query.q: Who won the most recent super bowl?
query.a: The Kansas City Chiefs won Super Bowl LIV (54) in 2020 by defeating the San Francisco 49ers 31-20.
